featured.text: A lover of tea since her childhood in Portugal, she brought tea-drinking to the English royal court and set a trend for the beverage in the seventeenth century.
Today, tea can be drunk at any time of the day, and accounts for over two-fifths of all beverages consumed in Britain—with the exception of water.
People only drank beverages with low alcohol content.
The consumption of alcoholic beverages was unusual in ancient Russia.

definition.zh_def: 飲料；任何可飲用的液體，通常指非酒精類的飲品。
definition.en_def: A liquid for drinking, especially one other than water.
definition.example: She ordered a refreshing beverage to enjoy on a hot day.
